name: RBI/2017-18/199 A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.31
summary: This circular reviews and modifies regulations regarding Foreign Portfolio Investors' (FPI) investments in debt instruments. Key changes include revising minimum residual maturity requirements, introducing new concentration limits, establishing online monitoring systems through CCIL, and modifying single/group investor-wise limits in corporate bonds. The circular provides operational flexibility and transition paths for FPIs and custodians, increases the cap on aggregate FPI investments in Central Government securities to 30%, and introduces specific definitions for short-term investments and exempted securities.
questions: What is the maximum percentage of short-term investments allowed for an FPI in any category?
